articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as Pakistan play Afghanistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Pakistan bat first against Afghanistan

articles.description: Looking back at the weekend's Premier League and WSL action, plus the latest tributes to England legend Sir Bobby Charlton.
articles.title: Premier League and WSL reaction

articles.description: England vice-captain Courtney Lawes will retire from international duty at the conclusion of the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: Lawes to retire from England duty at World Cup end

articles.description: Max Verstappen climbs up from sixth on the grid to win the US Grand Prix after a close battle with Lando Norris and Lewis Hamilton.
articles.title: Verstappen wins US GP ahead of charging Hamilton

articles.description: Durham fast bowler Brydon Carse replaces injured left-armer Reece Topley in England's World Cup squad.
articles.title: Carse replaces injured Topley in England squad

articles.description: Jermaine Jenas and Ben Mee analyse the new Aston Villa partnership of Ollie Watkins and Moussa Diaby.
articles.title: Watkins and Diaby - Aston Villa's 'fantastic' duo

articles.description: Bill Belichick becomes only the third head coach to win 300 NFL games as the New England Patriots upset the Buffalo Bills.
articles.title: Belichick joins 300 club as Patriots upset Bills

articles.description: How has Unai Emery turned around Aston Villa's fortunes and given them a chance of achieving "something really special" this season?
articles.title: 'We need to take our dreams' – special season for ‘flying’ Villa?

articles.description: World Rugby confirms it will formally review Bongi Mbonambi's alleged use of discriminatory language towards England's Tom Curry.
articles.title: World Rugby to review Mbonambi racial slur allegation

articles.description: Abdullah Shafique hits Mujeeb Ur Rahman for a six and four from consecutive balls as Pakistan reach 50 against Afghanistan during their Cricket World Cup game in Chennai.
articles.title: Abdullah hits Mujeeb for six and four as Pakistan reach 50
